item.title: Cutaneous fungal infection
item.description: Dermatophytosis Dermatophytes digest keratin and so can cause infection of skin and keratiniszed structures - hair & nails. Tinea corporis, pedis, capitis, unguium

item.title: Endocarditis
item.description: Fever + new murmur = infective endocarditis until proven otherwise Causes/Factors recent dental work renal failure immunosuppression Organisms - most common

item.title: Gastrointestinal Tract Bacterial Infections
item.description: These infections can be split into those causing illness by the toxins the bacteria produce versus the direct impact of the bacteria

item.title: HIV
item.description: Stages Primary - 2-6 weeks post infection - non-specific illness Secondary - Asymptomatic period Secondary - Symptomatic, immune destruction symptoms begin to appear Late Stage/end stage - AIDs defining

item.title: Infectious Mononucleosis
item.description: Glandular fever Spread through saliva caused almost exclusively from EBV ![[z_attachments/Pasted image 20230823125619.png]] Causes/Factors EBV virus colonisation, possibly at a older age than normal Symptoms Fatigue: Fever: Sore Throat: Swollen Lymph Nodes: Enlarged Spleen and Liver: Rash: Occasionally, a rash can develop.

item.title: Surgical Site Infections
item.description: Prophylactic antibiotics are given to counter the risk of wound infection which occurs in ~20% of elective surgeries and up to 60% in emergency surgery

item.title: Tuberculosis
item.description: Mycobacterium tuberculosis - can affect almost any organ Infects 1/3 of the world’s population - most common infectious cause of death
